definition: to put sth to rest/calm down a bit!
still/calm/quiet/not moving
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
still/calm/quiet/not moving

sentences.english: Pipe down , children. I'm trying to listen to the news on the radio.
sentences.chinese: 靜一靜，孩子們，我想聽無線電裏播送的新聞。

definition: graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
to go into a huff
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
to be in a bad mood
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
first decapitate then present your trophy (idiom); act first, report later
to blab/to shoot one's mouth off/to commit a gaffe
listener
to waste time on worthless activities
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
to have had enough of/to be fed up with/to have had one's fill of
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
indecisive/wavering
